item.title: 9 Geheimen voor betere fotografie op het strand
item.description:
9 Geheimen voor betere fotografie op het strand

Fotograferen in de buitenlucht is altijd leuk, maar aan het strand vind ik het altijd extra bijzonder. Je kunt er continu experimenteren met licht, water, mensen, dieren, grote composities of juist hele kleine details. Het strand, de zee en de duinen vormen altijd een fraai decor voor je foto's.

item.title: Brand New: New Logo and Identity for Ahold Delhaize by Futurebrand
item.description:
Brand New: New Logo and Identity for Ahold Delhaize by Futurebrand

Established this past Friday, Ahold Delhaize is one of the world's largest food retail groups with 22 different supermarket brands that account for 6,500 grocery and specialty stores in 11 countries. The new company is the result of a merger between Netherlands-based Ahold, established in 1887, and Belgium-based Delhaize Group, established in 1867, now collectively employing more than 375,000 people worldwide.

item.title: Brand New: New Logo for Subway
item.description:
Brand New: New Logo for Subway

Established in 1965 as Pete's Super Submarines (renamed in 1968 to how we know it today), Subway is a fast-food restaurant franchise serving sandwiches and salads through more than 44,000 locations in 112 countries, making it the largest fast-food chain in the world - McDonald's has 36,000 locations.

item.title: 4 things you didn't know about the Rio 2016 Olympics logo
item.description:
4 things you didn't know about the Rio 2016 Olympics logo

How do you create the logo design for the most complex visual identity in the world? The Olympic Games is a tough gig for any firm: once you've won the project - through a prolonged bidding process that can pit over one hundred studios against each other - there's a long list of organisations and competing aims to satisfy, and a target audience of the whole world.

item.title: Dark Political Cartoons Show How Technology Is Our New Master | The Creators Project
item.description:
Dark Political Cartoons Show How Technology Is Our New Master | The Creators Project

Images courtesy the artist While you might not know his name, you've almost certainly seen the work of Polish illustrator Pawel Kuczynski. Known for political cartoons that stick in your mind as much as your social media feed, Kuczynski's work is constantly circulating Reddit, Facebook, and Instagram.

item.title: Optical Adjustment - Logic vs. Designers
item.description:
Optical Adjustment - Logic vs. Designers

In my early days as a designer, I relied on Photoshop or CSS to tell me whether something was right or wrong. If Photoshop indicated that two shapes were aligned, then they were aligned. If two different shapes were the same size, then that was the case.

item.title: 'Light field' camera maker Lytro announces professional VR video rig
item.description:
'Light field' camera maker Lytro announces professional VR video rig

Camera maker Lytro drew our attention three years ago with what it called "light field" photography. Instead of focusing at a specific depth, its camera would capture everything in range of its finder, so you could do things like pick a focus after taking the picture.

item.title: Photos of Various Food Dishes Flying Through the Air
item.description:
Photos of Various Food Dishes Flying Through the Air

Camden, London-based commercial still life photographer Piotr Gregorczyk likes to play with food and gravity. One concept he has focused on for a number of recent projects is the idea of showing various food dishes flying through the air as they come together on a plate or in a bowl.

item.title: Spotify's Design Lead on Why Side Projects Should Be Stupid
item.description:
Spotify's Design Lead on Why Side Projects Should Be Stupid

Tobias van Schneider lives his life like one big side project. Today, he designs and builds new products for Spotify in New York, but he couldn't have predicted that when he dropped out of school at age 15 to work as an apprentice in a computer shop in Austria.

item.title: Projections in the Forest
item.description:
Projections in the Forest

Behind the scenes: http://vimeo.com/3hund/behindthescenes The projection mapping "bioluminescent forest" is made by artists Friedrich van Schoor and Tarek Mawad. The artists spent six weeks in the forest fascinated by the silence and natural occurrences in nature, especially the phenomenon "bioluminescence".
